content: Singaporean politician **Andy Gan Lai Chiang** ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 颜来章; born 1948) is a Singaporean former politician. As a member of the governing [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) (PAP), he represented the [Marine Parade Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Marine_Parade_Group_Representation_Constituency) (GRC) between 2001 and 2006. ## Career Gan first stood in the (/wiki/1991_Singaporean_general_election) and [1997 general elections](/wiki/1997_Singaporean_general_election) in [Potong Pasir Single Member Constituency](/wiki/Potong_Pasir_Single_Member_Constituency) (SMC), losing to incumbent [Chiam See Tong](/wiki/Chiam_See_Tong). In the [2001 general election](/wiki/2001_Singaporean_general_election), he ran in [Marine Parade GRC](/wiki/Marine_Parade_Group_Representation_Constituency); the PAP team won uncontested. He retired from politics in the [2006 general election](/wiki/2006_Singaporean_general_election). ## Early life A great-great-grandson of [Gan Eng Seng](/wiki/Gan_Eng_Seng), Gan was educated at Kwong Avenue School, [Victoria School](/wiki/Victoria_School), [Singapore Polytechnic](/wiki/Singapore_Polytechnic) and the [University of Western Australia](/wiki/University_of_Western_Australia). This article about a politician from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Andy Gan
